column5: Bly and my daughter went out yesterday to feed some animals down at a local conservation area. With bird seed in hand they set off a nice little walk. The birds came from every direction!! Landing in their hands, in the seed bucket...and one even perched itself on bly's hat. Here's a short video of their visit.....

cool video   cliff,its to bad angelina was in school carol was very nice in inviting julie and ang,to go feed the birds as well,....i had one fly right in my car when i was feeding them ,he didnt want me to go,and followed me to my car,they are so tame and just cant wait to you feed them and im sure sydney had fun...cheers

I really enjoyed that.  We have many bird houses and in winter a couple of feeders in the birch tree by one of the front windows.  The wife and I sit and watch the birds almost every morning.  I use watching them for serenity before facing the normal day.

I wish that Ang and I could have went, but she was in school that day   It was great for Carol to call me and invite us to come along, she would have thought that was something else! Hopefully us girls can get together soon and go to feed the birds
Wow, that's really cool Cliff, really neat that they landed right on your hands.  Thanks for sharing that.  Joey
"Local con park" would that be Lynde Shores by chance? I was down last week looking for Saw Whet Owls. I have taken my girls down there. it is real kewl on how well trained these Chickadees are!
Ron...those are some amazing pictures you have there!!! Thanks for sharing...and yes...it was Lynde Shores!
